On Sep 21, 2004, at 2:58 PM, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

> Timothy Wall wrote:
>
>> You can certainly write a class loader that *doesn't* delegate loading
>> to the parent/primordial, but that path is fraught with exceptions and
>> errors (of the ClassCast and Linkage types) and painstaking to get
>> exactly right.
>
> The good news is that, if you test-drive the solution, you'll leave
> behind a trail of tests that will let you know the moment you go off 
> the
> rails in future. It may just be the only safe/sane way to do it. :)
>

The problem is that the linkage and class cast errors show up 
differently depending on the linkage/dependencies particular to the 
class being loaded, and may also vary depending on what the runtime has 
been doing, none of which gets captured in the "trail of tests".   I've 
had narrow success in one case, but the usage is *very* restricted.
